comments.body: I'm of the opinion that the actual type of `React.Fragment` should be opaque to clients. The fact that it is a `symbol | number` is an implementation detail. As @tkrotoff suggested I would feel better about changing references to an alias like `type FragmentType = symbol & 0xeacb;`
Unfortunately, our type aliases aren't opaque. So creating something like `type FragmentType = symbol | 0xeacb;` wouldn't be visible by clients anyway.

All I'm saying is this test shouldn't be testing that `React.Fragment` is a `symbol | number`, because that's liable to change. Something like

```ts
const fragmentType: React.FragmentType = React.Fragment
```

would be appropriate.
A type like `symbol & 0xeacb` prevents users from making a mistake by passing a `number` into `createElement`.
